- Science or Physics simulations are "Science", NOT "Game".
- If code is empty or under 50 characters, output: SKIP
- Never invent function names. Only cite what exists in the code.

Only cite what exists in the code. Analyze this file from self-refine-cli: README.md ``` # ð§  Self-Refine CLI â Autonomous Self-Improving Agent
**A fully autonomous, self-improving AI agent that generates code, verifies it, learns from mistakes, and continuously upgrades its own capabilities.** [![Python 3.10+](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.10+-blue.svg)](https://www.python.org/downloads/) [![llama.cpp](https://img.shields.io/badge/inference-llama.cpp-green.svg)](https://github.com/ggerganov/llama.cpp) [![Local Hardware](https://img.shields.io/badge/runs%20on-local%20GPU-orange.svg)](#requirements)
> â ï¸ **100% LOCAL** â Runs entirely on your machine using llama.cpp with Vulkan GPU acceleration. No paid APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google). Perfect for AI experimentation on your own hardware. --- ## ð¯ What This Project Does This is not just another LLM wrapper. **Self-Refine CLI** is an autonomous agent that: 1. **Generates coding tasks** for itself with adaptive difficulty 2. **Spawns 3 parallel workers** that each generate, execute, and verify code 3. **Selects the best verified solution** from workers 4. **Iteratively refines** the solution using self-feedback 5. **Learns lessons** from successes and failures into long-term memory 6. **Harvests skills** â verified functions become reusable for future tasks 7. **Adjusts difficulty** â curriculum learning based on performance history The result: an agent that **improves itself over time** without human intervention. --- ## ðï¸ Architecture Overview ``` Tell me what it demonstrates about the developer:
output:
DOMAIN: DevOps
